alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Massac; Pope (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 31 at 3:39PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Moderate rainfall may lead to localized flooding Wednesday Night into Thursday... Moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected to develop ahead of a slow moving Arctic cold front Wednesday night into Thursday. Soil conditions remain quite moist across the region ahead of the expected rainfall. The ground will have less capacity to absorb the rain, causing the rain to runoff quicker into ditches, creeks and streams. The colder temperatures expected with the approaching Arctic cold front will also lessen the evaporation of the rainfall. Western Kentucky, extreme southern Illinois, and the Delta Region of southeast Missouri will be most vulnerable to rapid rises of water levels in low-lying and poorly drained locations. Some overland flooding may occur, especially in flood prone areas, later Thursday and Thursday night. If you live or work in areas especially prone to flooding, stay tuned to the latest forecast and monitor for statements regarding flooding potential in your area later this week.
